section_text:
The provisions in the following chapters and sections shall constitute and be designated
               as the "Code of Ordinances, Burke County, North Carolina," and may be so cited. Such
               Code may also be cited as the Burke County Code.
               
            

               (Code 1993, Â§ 1-1)
               
            
State Law referenceâ€” 
               Authority of county to adopt and issue a code of its ordinances, G.S. 153A-49; pleading
               and proving county ordinances, G.S. 153A-50; general ordinance-making power, G.S.
               153A-121; territorial jurisdiction of ordinances, G.S. 153A-122; authority not limited
               by enumeration of powers, G.S. 153A-124.
